poem:
The Paper Shield

A tattered sheet  
crimson with ink,  
holds nothing  
but the weight  
of men's breaths.

Unfurled  
by brash voices,  
it shudders,  
its tale  
retold by wind.

Yet between lines,  
echoes linger,  
resilient whispers  
of forgotten  
truths.
